name: Heroine's Quest: The Herald of Ragnarok
description: A retro styled adventure/RPG hybrid with atmosphere reminiscent of the classics. Play as warrior, sorceress, or rogue as you travel through the rich world of Norse mythology to keep the world from eternal winter. Each class has different puzzle solutions, making for good replay value. The game is completely free, no hidden costs.

reviews.review_text: If I could recommend this twice, I would.  I grew up in the Sierra games era. A beautiful time to be a gamer. Truly. This game is quite the King's Quest homage.   If you enjoyed the awesomeness of Sierra's point-and-click adventures, get this game. You will have ZERO regrets.   LOVE IT.  (PS: As I was corrected, it is more a homage to the Quest for Glory series but if you enjoyed any of Sierra's point-and-click adventures, you will NOT be disappointed!)

Why does this game exist all of the sudden? I have no idea. Why is it free? Still clueless.  What I do know is that whoever made this game was very passionate. Nearly every single object in this game can be talked to, interacted with, and looked at all with humrous consequence; the game chiding your every stupid move. Not to say that this makes it a good game, but it's one of the many clear indications that the developer put a lot of time into the title and didn't want to make any action you could possibly do feel simple or redundant.  Not just an adventure game, it's also a straight up Western RPG. The NPCs are deep and the fighting mechanics are simple yet refined. Given that I haven't played any other point and click rpgs in my life, (such as the Hero's quest series that the game is based off of) I don't know how it compares; but I've enjoyed what I've seen so far.

As someone who loved the old Sierra games of King's Quest and Quest for Glory, this was a wonderful retro romp into my childhood. This game is lovingly created to honor these old games, and to create an all new journey and world for us to play. I absolutely adored this game. It had me laughing and grinning all the way through at the jokes, the easter eggs, and just plain good fun that this game was made with. I recommend it to anyone who ever wanted another one of those old adventure games, or anyone who just loves a good puzzle game. There is a lot of replayability as you can solve the puzzles in many different ways depending on what you do and what class you play. There is just so much to enjoy in this game that I could go on for hours, and I have to my own friends.   Two thumbs way up and I rather hope they create a sequel so I can play more in this world.

Great retro RPG/point-and-click adventure with a female protagonist. Enjoyable story, nice soundtrack, plenty of humor, lots of Norse mythology references, very well made game all around.  Amazing it is free.

Wonderful love letter to the Quest for Glory series, and 100% FREE to boot. I was an old member of the Hero6 scene back in the day and remember the first screenshots of this game. Wonderful to see it finally released years later.  Great things: + Old Norse setting really adds to the game, with appearances by Loki, the valkyries, Sigurd, frost giants and tons of lore that will make you want to read up on viking mythology. + RPG stats really do matter, much more so than they did in the Quest for Glory games.  + Combat system is fairly deep in the spirit of Quest for Glory 2; true, eventually you get strong enough to just click your way through most battles but each enemy has certain 'tells' that you need to watch out for and dodging attacks takes practice. There are also many more enemies than I expected. + TONS of sidequests, and many are optional. Rogues, since they can steal stuff, actually have the option to bypass what feels like 80% of the side stuff in this game, making the replay value really substantial. + For a free AGS game, Heroine's Quest feels remarkably 'alive', more so than some commercial releases. All of the characters have their own schedules and say different things when they're in the presence of different people. Some might find this annoying, since it can be hard to find a character during a certain time of day unless you know their schedule down to the hour, but I felt it added a lot of life to the adventuring experience.  Not as great things: + Main character is bland. I realize she's a blank slate like the hero in Quest for Glory (who was also bland but at least silent), but since the devs made the decision to make her talk, I felt they could have added more spice to her dialogue. She could have been as memorable as Roehm from Quest for Infamy. + I know quest logs aren't a traditional feature of adventure games, but this game could have benefitted from one since there are just so many side quests to keep track of. + Sometimes things veer into infamous 'adventure game logic'. Occasionally items that can be picked up are not obvious on screen and certain puzzle solutions seem illogical. I used the official walkthrough more than I would've liked and certainly would not have guessed that Rogues need to escape the blizzard with Heime by combining a certain two items. + Speaking of Rogues, it's REALLY easy to get caught by guards when thieving in this game. A few warning messages like 'That was a close call! You really shouldn't try robbing that house again.' or 'Do you REALLY want to pick his pocket?' might have been appreciated.   Neutral: + The food/rest/freezing mechanic definitely won't be liked by all! At the start of the game it's so hard to pass out from the cold...this really makes the first few in-game days tough since you're constantly retreating back to town for warmth and worrying about food. I didn't mind this, since it really makes you feel like a badass at the end when you're just running through the forest with your stamina barely dropping. But I also 'cheated' a few times by dropping the difficulty to zero when I was in danger of freezing/starving, lol...  Anyway, nitpicks aside - a lovely game! This came out the same time as Quest for Infamy, so I know a lot of people are wondering which of the two are better. Well, this one's FREE, and you can't beat that, but they're both good. In the end, Quest for Infamy is funnier and has a slightly more epic scope, but Heroine's Quest provides a tighter experience with better RPG mechanics and lore. Play both if you're an old school QFG fan.

Started playing Heroine's Quest: The Herald Of Ragnarok because it's free. So far, I've died of exhaustion from trying to talk to a dog. This is most excellent, and almost all you need to know about this fabulous and much-needed resurrection of the point-and-click comedy adventure RPG, aside from the likeable characters, the Norse-themed plot, and the pretty darn easy-to-use combat system.  When you play, make sure you examine/poke at/talk to everything---the descriptions are worth it.

★★★★★   What an incredible game already, the little I've played it. But you can read from thier own website just how the awards are going for it! March 9th, Heroine's Quest wins the AGS Awards for best game, story, gameplay, background art, portrait art, animation, music, sound, puzzles, dialogue, and voice acting! In the Old school type Sierra games from back when comes a 'FREE' game? Are they serious? I'm sure there are many of us that would have bought this title. A personal thank you to CrystalShard for it. And thank you for letting me borrow your AGS award info to write this quick review for you. That's the very least I and others could do!

Five Reasons Why You Should Play This:  1. It is FREE (of course, after playing the game for about two hours and feel thoroughy impressed with it, I recommend you go to the developer's website and make a donation ;-) 2. It is hugely addictive. When I first played this game, I also had three other games going. After I hit 'new game' on Heroine's Quest, the other three games pretty much just languished in the dust pile 3. You can play as Warrior, Mage, or Rogue. Each with different puzzles and pathways to progress the game. This means high replayability 4. Likeable heroine and NPCs. Voice acting was top-notch 5. Doom Squirrel. This game has THE DOOM SQUIRREL. Kneel in awe to the SQUIRREL OF DOOM.

Lets see... where do i begin? Well for starters, i actually assumed this game was made in the 90s because of its retro feel. It was made fairly recently, in 2013.That's actually one of my favorite aspects of the game. It's simple, easy to follow and contains an excellent soundtrack! The story's compelling enough to make you want to play this game again. The game offers plenty of variety in terms of customization! Another plus to the game is that there is a female protagonist in the game (hense the name Heroines Quest) and the character does not look promiscuous! Voice acting is excellent and it shows the developers dedicated themselves to making such a wonderfully simple RPG. The game also contains a wonderful soundtrack! The only dislike I have is that is there is not an opportunity to explore the other worlds/realms in this game. in chapter 2 where the norns ask of your destination(which is Svartelfeim), if you select any other world besides Svartelfeim (along with answering questions about what you seek and who told you to do so), your character gets sent to the void and you lose the game. Also, in the begining of the game there is a quest which involves another realm, but you do not get a chance to also do that quest. Overall a wonderful game to play, and I would definately recommend it! =)

Brings me back to my favorite RPG's that I grew up with (Kings Quest/Quest for Glory). To top it off, it spoofs a few of their greatest moments (as well as other games), and it is far longer game play then typical adventure rpg's.  To top it off, it is better than most pay rpg's, AND it is free! There should be no reason why a lover of the old adventure games doesn't try it.   (Warning: There is one negative that stand out similarly to classic rpg's. If you don't save/keep saves at certain check points, you may get stuck while being unable to continue forward.)
A classic style adventure game. Worth way more than it's listed for, which is free.
What a tribute to Quest For Glory, a must have for all Sierra adventure game fans. Actually it's more then a tribute because it builds on what was so great on Quest for Glory and adds new things too.
I felt very nostalgic playing this one. And it's a very well done game, the art, soundtrack and storyline are awesome!

Great game! It's a tribute to all those adventure games we loved during our youth. It didn't stay there though. Nice voice acting, multiple solution paths and have I mentioned it's free? Definately try it.
I would pay money for this, as in, $20 kind of money, what a fantastic game.

I love this game and I also love the variation between classes. This reminds me of old adventure games like Kings Quest and seeing a game in a simmilar style  but as an rpg, this game blends my three favourite genres together. This is a awesome, challenging point and click rpg hybrid. The fact that it is free is awesome as well.
This game is awesome reminds me of the old Quest for Glory games. Its free to can't beat that :)

With an amazing soundtrack and storyline you´ll find yourself back in the era were loki and thor were still fighting for daddys love while your heroine saves the world. The game is set back in the norse mythology were a Heroine is called fort to stand against the brutal forces of the frost giant and put an end to the lasting winter. The game as its funny moments that will surely make you laugh, such as the two headed troll Thrivaldi arguing with himself and the mighty rat of Doom that adds DOOM into every word is speaks. Choosing between 3 classes, her might, sorcery and cunning may be humanity’s last resort. Are you ready to adventure yourself in this epic adventure? Or, will you die trying?
Very nice game

Heroine's Quest: The Herald of Ragnarok is a free adventure RPG game with a retro look. It worked, looked ok, played ok, sounded ok. Has english voiceovers. You can play a Female Traveller with a choice of warrior, mage, or rogue. Has many steam achievements. Sort of like Siera's Hero Quest or Quest for Glory. Try it, if you like retro games. Absolutely amazing! Anyone who loved the Hero's Quest/Quest for Glory series back in the day should absolutely play this. It is as great an homage to those games as could be imagined.

This game is really, really good! If you're a fan of Quest for Glory and the old Sierra adventure games, you will LOVE this one. I haven't experienced anything like this since QFG back in the 90's. Great writing, attention to detail in terms of getting the old school point and click genre right, and I am surprised that it's currently free. Would gladly pay for a game this great, you can tell the developers really captured the essence of the old classics in this release.
”Look out, Heroine! A POIsonous Ragnarok!”
Combines Old-school gameplay and just enough simplicity to help newbies get accustomed to it.
As someone who grew up loving Quest for Glory 1 though 5, I cannot praise this game enough.
Good oldskool type game. Very Windows 95. In a good way. Best part Is it's free. :D

I loved the Hero's Quest or Quest for Glory series, and this game is able to capture what was great about that series and make it better, with the amazing bonus of a female protagonist. The voice acting was a very nice and appreciated feature as well.
Worth every penny - and it's free .. :D
Very fun

If you were a fan of the old Sierra games (a la Hero's or King's Quest) then this game is a must. MUST! The magic map and notepad are nice touches - while pencil crayoning your own map as a kid was fun, having a magic map is better.  Pro tip: For those not used to these games, save often. It's like a choose your own adventure where you can die for silly reasons. To me that adds charm, to someone that hasn't saved the game in awhile, that can be frustrating.  Note: * There are some people giving negative reviews because the frostbite is hard... turns out if you don't like that, you can turn it off in the settings. It reminded me of QFG2 (?) in the dessert. Good times imo.  * Some negative reviews mention bad graphics... which makes me laugh because they are done on purpose that way. Kickin' it old school.

Awesome so far!  A female protagonist, many in-jokes, good voice-acting, pixelated retro style. If you enjoyed games like Quest for Glory, you'll love Heroine's Quest! You can also change the difficulty, so even gamers who are new to RPGs can easily get into this one.  And it's for free, come on, you have nothing to lose!

this game. omg. i am a HUGE HUGE fan of the old quest for glory for the dos. i am an old pc gamer. i grew up on having to type everything out c:/dos/quest1/run.exe before you can even start the game. it brings back huge memories to see this. its so awesome. the gameplay and style are exactly the same. poor sierra they used to make such good adventure games. its great to see this come back. i really hope they make more. there is one qualm i dont like about this game though. the chill factor. you cant explore much without getting too cold or too hungry too fast. so you will spend alot of time grinding lower areas till your stamina and endurance can handle it. fighting is once again great for the old style. alittle confusing at first but when you get it down you find yourself scrambling back to heal till you get better. other then that i would highly reccomend this to oldschool gamers. these young'uns perfer graphics and blam bloom pow excitement. this is for those who enjoy a casual gaming experience and dont mind the small grind before excitemnet. aka fallout or wasteland the long before the storm.
I'm thoroughly enjoying this game. So much fun. Takes me back....
Great game, great story, I spent many hours having fun solving quests. Thank you, developers!
This game teaches a lot about Norse mythology. It has a good feel to it and it's free! Don't try this game if you dislike lore and history.

What?!?  This game is totally free...  Good voice acting, made me laugh out loud twice within an hour, and an homage to Hero's Quest (which was the EGA version of Quest for Glory 1 which had to change its name because of a copyright infringment by Sierra from the Milton Bradley company with a board game based on the same name).  WHAT??!  Friggin' good, yo.
Ahh... back to the good old days of Sierra puzzle RPGs. Has the occasional 'breaking the fourth wall' comedy which I quite enjoy.

I grew up on the Quest for Glory series, playing the ever living heck out of them. Heroine's Quest is like a brand new Quest for Glory game, with the same style of writing, humor, the same kind of dialogue interactions and quest dynamics, the same kind of RPG mechanics worked in and overall it has the same kind of feel, yet has improvements made thanks to the advances of time. It doesn't feel as dated as it might have if they hadn't made any of the tweaks they did.  Having it be a Heroine just adds substantially to my enjoyment of this game. It's not often I get to actually play as my gender in a game that acknowledges it freely in its dialogue.  The voice acting is ridiculously good. Quest for Glory IV, back in 1994, had some of the very best voice acting you will ever hear in a video game, and this game is right up there with it. Compared to the wooden, monotone voice acting you get in so many other video games, it's such a treat.  This is a blast from my past and yet brand new to me, and it's all I ever wanted in a game. I only wish two things of it: that you could have romanced a female character (because yay girl love!) and that there was a sequel available I could play too.
fun game, recommend it ;)

I tell everyone about this game! If you grew up playing adventure games like King's Quest series you'll love this. The game is a lot of fun, the music is catchy with a MIDI nostalgic feel, the voice acting isn't *always* the best but nothing there has ruined me from having a good time. The art has that old school sprite feel, and the writing is quirky and amusing. Right from the beginning you can pick a class, and I'm seeing further into the game how being a different class changes gameplay - there's great replay value here. I don't know what else to say. The game is free, try it out for yourself. If you love it as much as I do, donate to the creators!

The Norse mythology in this game is really fun, and characters explain a lot of the references to sagas that they make. The game is fully voiced, and the actors have done a fine job. The retro feel of the graphics are nostalgic and almost refreshing in a way. I love how the character can interact with the world around her, too--try talking to a bird or a mounted animal head--it's quite funny!
How is this game FREE ? It's like the Quest for Glory games of old, fully voice acted, various play styles, day/night cycle as well as combat. Great story to boot. Truly amazing.
if you liked Quest For Glory you'll love this
First of all,this game not bad....also i love point and clicks adventure,i love the puzzle and the story so....l would give 8/10
A great tribute to old Sierra's Quest for Glory/Hero's Quest. If You want to see how great adventure games looked in eighties, try it!

This one was a real joy to play.  It's very reminiscent of old point and click adventure games, has a basic inventory, and I found the combat and mechanics easy to learn.  There are usually several options you can choose to solve a particular problem, depending on your class. The story is good, revolving around Norse mythology, and everything was beautifully drawn.  I usually never get around to finishing most games, but this one I just couldn't leave until I managed to fnish it. It's leagues above most -paid- games in its genre I've tried. Definitely recommended.

Heroine's quest is a fantastic epic adventure/rpg hybrid with excellent artwork, writing, music, and voice acting. Not only that, but it is available for the amazing price of FREE, and puts lots of paid games to shame with its wealth of content and production values.   There are 3 variations to your character (warrior, sorceress, rogue) which allows you to tackle obstacles and puzzles within the spectrum of full blooded violence to subtle subterfuge, providing lots of gameplay differences and replayability.   You can tell a lot of dedication, hard work, and love went into this at every stage of the game. Highly recommended for any adventure or RPG fans.
Absolutely loved it, especially all of the mythology. Frustrating how easily you can f-up, but brilliant as well.
Love this game. Anyone who loved QFG will love this game
Awesome little old school adventure game, it's free as well so there is no reason not to get it.

To anyone who is a true fan of the Quest for Glory games, don't expect this game to deliver the same quality of experience. I have played about 5 hours into it and don't know if I'll continue. It's not a bad game at all, but it definitly doesn't live up to it's namesake. Where Quest for Glory games basically let you roam free and figure the world out for yourself, this game constantly holds your hand and tells you what to do 'next'. There is even a mechanic to actively discourage you from exploration. Where Quest for Glory was your story, this game is set on telling its own story and forces you to take part in it. That's not the Heros Quest I remember.  After reading so many reviews raving about this game, I can't help but be a little annoyed. The voice acting is ok, but the dialog feels like it's never going to end at times. The music is not horrible, but I've actually read reviews saying it was as fitting as QFG music. That is especially ridiculous and painful to read.   I just felt I had to say something as even though this may be a nicely made game, it is a pale shadow of the Quest for Glory series and does not deserve the loftly praise of being on par with it.

I didn't like this game enough to keep it and now I can't get all of it's data (including a music list) deleted which adds to my disinterest in this game. My review would be better if I could get the game completely off my account and system.

It's an okay game, but I find it slow and boring. But if you don't like the game, unlike other F2P games, you can't uninstall it. Also, there is no way to get Steam Trading Cards for this game, even though it has them.  I don't like this game.
